snippet: Comedy shows lifted CBS in the ratings on Monday night, but the powers of a reality dating show on ABC appear to be fading.
abstract: Comedy shows lifted CBS in the ratings on Monday night, but the powers of a reality dating show on ABC appear to be fading.
lead_paragraph: Could the television broadcast audience be growing less susceptible to the charms of "The Bachelor" on ABC? The season premiere of the series averaged 7.7 million total viewers over a two-hour period on Monday night, according to Nielsen data, down from the 9 million viewers who watched the 15th-season premiere last January. There was also a 17 percent drop in the 18-to-49-year-old demographic when compared with last year. This placed ABC a distant second in the overall ratings among the broadcast networks, behind the CBS Monday comedy block. CBS finished No. 1 in all ratings categories in every prime-time half-hour.

headline.main: Fewer Viewers Check Out 'The Bachelor' on ABC
